archetype_name: Family Weekend Showstopper: Spanish & Portuguese Feasts
name: Asturian-Style Fabada with Chorizo, Ham, and Sausage
description: A slow-simmered Iberian bean feast layered with chorizo, ham, and sausage, gently perfumed with paprika, bay, and saffron. A hearty, showpiece pot for a lingering family dinner.
prep_steps: Rinse 500 g cannellini beans and soak in plenty of water overnight (8–12 hours). Drain before cooking.
Slice 300 g chorizo into thick rounds.
Cut 250 g ham into chunky cubes.
Slice 250 g sausage into thick coins.
Measure spices: 2 tsp paprika, 2 bay leaves, a pinch of saffron, 1 tsp salt, and 1 tsp black pepper.
Boil a kettle or have 1.5–2 liters water ready hot.
Optional: Preheat oven to 150°C (300°F) if you prefer finishing the stew in the oven.
cook_steps: Set a large heavy pot over medium heat and add 2 tbsp olive oil.
Add chorizo and sausage; cook 5–7 minutes until lightly browned and some fat renders. Scoop meats to a bowl, leaving fat in the pot.
Add ham to the pot; brown 3–4 minutes. Transfer to the bowl with the other meats.
Add onions to the pot with a pinch of salt; cook 8–10 minutes until soft and golden.
Stir in garlic and paprika; cook 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add drained cannellini beans, bay leaves, saffron, and all browned meats (plus any juices) back to the pot.
Pour in hot water to cover by 3–4 cm (about 1.5–2 liters). Bring to a gentle simmer.

Season with 1 tsp salt and 1 tsp black pepper. Partially cover and simmer very gently 75–90 minutes, stirring occasionally, until beans are creamy and tender. Add hot water as needed to keep beans just submerged.
Optional oven finish: After the pot returns to a simmer, cover and transfer to the 150°C (300°F) oven for 60–75 minutes, checking once or twice to maintain a gentle bubble.
Adjust seasoning with salt and black pepper. Rest off heat 10 minutes to thicken slightly.
Ladle into warm bowls and drizzle with a little olive oil to serve.
instructions: Rinse 500 g cannellini beans and soak in plenty of water overnight (8–12 hours). Drain before cooking.
Peel and finely chop 2 onions.
Peel and slice 6 garlic cloves.
Slice 300 g chorizo into thick rounds.
Cut 250 g ham into chunky cubes.
Slice 250 g sausage into thick coins.
Measure spices: 2 tsp paprika, 2 bay leaves, a pinch of saffron, 1 tsp salt, and 1 tsp black pepper.
Boil a kettle or have 1.5–2 liters water ready hot.
Optional: Preheat oven to 150°C (300°F) if you prefer finishing the stew in the oven.
Set a large heavy pot over medium heat and add 2 tbsp olive oil.
Add chorizo and sausage; cook 5–7 minutes until lightly browned and some fat renders. Scoop meats to a bowl, leaving fat in the pot.
Add ham to the pot; brown 3–4 minutes. Transfer to the bowl with the other meats.
Add onions to the pot with a pinch of salt; cook 8–10 minutes until soft and golden.
Stir in garlic and paprika; cook 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add drained cannellini beans, bay leaves, saffron, and all browned meats (plus any juices) back to the pot.
Pour in hot water to cover by 3–4 cm (about 1.5–2 liters). Bring to a gentle simmer.

Season with 1 tsp salt and 1 tsp black pepper. Partially cover and simmer very gently 75–90 minutes, stirring occasionally, until beans are creamy and tender. Add hot water as needed to keep beans just submerged.
Optional oven finish: After the pot returns to a simmer, cover and transfer to the 150°C (300°F) oven for 60–75 minutes, checking once or twice to maintain a gentle bubble.
Adjust seasoning with salt and black pepper. Rest off heat 10 minutes to thicken slightly.
Ladle into warm bowls and drizzle with a little olive oil to serve.
